key_points: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Harry and Meghan, have reportedly quit social media.
The couple had over 10 million followers on their official royal Instagram account, @sussexroyal.
They became disillusioned by the "hate" encountered online, particularly on platforms like Instagram.
The Sunday Times reports that there are no plans for their non-profit, Archewell, to use social media, nor for them to return personally.
This decision comes amid criticism of social media companies for their role in political events, specifically referencing Donald Trump's indefinite suspension.
Harry and Meghan's move away from social media follows their step down as senior royals and a move towards financial independence in the US.
Meghan has spoken out about the severe impact of online abuse on her mental health, claiming to be the most trolled person in 2019.
Archewell aims to drive systemic cultural change through non-profit work and media production, without an official social media presence.
The couple has signed deals with Spotify and Netflix to produce podcasts and documentaries.
Previously, they had stated an intention to continue using social media after stepping down as senior royals.
